CONTENTS.P: Project name: Rustavi Solid Waste Management Project
Country: Georgia
Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure
Project ID: 40019
Funding source: SIDA
Type of contract: Supply and installation
Type of notice: Invitation for Tenders
Issue date: 23.2.2018
Closing date: 14.3.2018 at 15:30 local (Tbilisi) time
This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice for this project which was published in Procurement Opportunities on 22.6.2017 (Ref. 8739-GPN-40019).

Solid Waste Management Company of Georgia Ltd. (the Employer) has received a grant from Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (SIDA) administered by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) to improve landfill operation and waste sorting plant operation at Rustavi Landfill, in Gardabani municipality of Georgia.
The Employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contracts to be funded from part of the proceeds of the grant:

— supply and Installation Works of Heating, Ventilation and Air-conditioning System in Waste Sorting Facility at Rustavi Solid Waste Landfill. The deadline for completion of the works will be 60 (sixty) calendar days from the date of the contract signature.

Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of Sida grant is open to firms from all countries. The proceeds of the grant will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations.

The contract is being procured via a local competitive tendering in accordance with the Bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules. The procurement of the contract is subject to Georgian public procurement legislation, thus the tenderers are strongly advised to familiarize themselves and abide by it. The notice has been advertised in Georgia at State Procurement Agency’s (SPA) website at the following web link: www.spa.ge

The detailed instructions for prospective tenderers to access online publication are as follows: tenderers shall visit SPA’s web link indicated above (www.spa.ge); down on the right side of the page shall switch the language from Georgian into English (press ENG); after switching to English language scroll up on the same page and press the button called “eProcurement”; after being redirected on “eProcurement” page, press the button called “Guest”; after being redirected, on “Guest” page on the left upper part find the box / window called “Tender Registration Number”; in the box/window called “Tender Registration Number” indicate Procurement Notice / Tender registration number NAT180003185 and press Enter; on the right side of the same page will appear the link to the online publication and press the link.
To be qualified for the award of the contract, tenderers must meet the following minimum qualification criteria:

— starting from 1.1.2013, a tenderer must have revenues of at least 400 000 GEL (four hundred thousand), approximately 132 000 EUR (one hundred and thirty two thousand) (the source for exchange rate: www.nbg.ge) from Supply and Installation Works of Heating, Ventilation and Air-conditioning System (CPV Code: 45331000) in / at buildings. However at least one contract price / value must be no less than 50 000 GEL (fifty thousand), approximately 16 500 EUR (sixteen thousand and five hundred). The specified revenues shall be substantiated by pertinent documents.

The tender documents may be obtained free of charge from the SPA’s web link indicated above. The tender documents are in Georgian and English languages, however in case of any pending/arguable issue(s) triggered by the discrepancy from Georgian and English tender documents, Georgian tender documents shall govern.

All tenders must be accompanied by a Tender Security of 2 070 GEL (two thousand and seventy), approximately 680 EUR (six hundred and eighty), which is 1 (one)% of the cost estimate as required by Georgian public procurement legislation. The amount of the Tender Security is directly transferred in the form of bank transfer to SPA’s bank account (tenderers are advised to visit SPA’s web link indicated above).
Prospective tenderers may obtain further information from the following office:
For queries in Georgian:
Contact name: Ana Gurgenidze
Executing agency: Solid Waste Management Company of Georgia Limited
Address: A. Politkovskaia Str. 10, 0186 Tbilisi, Georgia
Mail: gurgenidze_ana@yahoo.com; a.gurgenidze@waste.gov.ge
For queries in English:
